meanings.definition: To have a feeling of dislike or aversion towards something.
meanings.sent1: She disrelished the taste of the bitter medicine.
meanings.sent2: He disrelished the idea of going to the dentist.
meanings.sent3: The cat disrelished the new brand of cat food, turning her nose up at it.
meanings.sent4: The student disrelished the thought of having to take a pop quiz.
meanings.sent5: The child disrelished the sound of thunder, hiding under the covers.

meanings.definition: To not enjoy or appreciate something.
meanings.sent1: They disrelished the movie because it was too scary for them.
meanings.sent2: She disrelished the cold weather, preferring sunny days.
meanings.sent3: The picky eater disrelished the sight of vegetables on his plate.
meanings.sent4: The artist disrelished the blank canvas, feeling uninspired.
meanings.sent5: He disrelished the loud music, covering his ears to block out the noise.
